greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} 3^(n-k)*A123125(n, k).
comment: a(n+1) = [1,4,22,160,1456,...] is the first Eulerian transform of A000244 (powers of 3), it is also the Stirling transform of A080599(n+1) = [1,3,12,66,450,...].
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
T. J. Stieltjes, Sur quelques intégrales définies et leur développement en fractions continues, Q. J. Math., London, 24, 1890, pp. 370-382.
T. J. Stieltjes, Sur quelques intégrales définies et leur développement en fractions continues, LXXVII, p.382, Stieltjes T.J. Oeuvres complètes, tome 2, Noordhoff, 1918, 617p.
formula: O.g.f.: Sum_{n>=0} n! * x^n / Product_{k=1..n} (1-2*k*x). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Jul 20 2011
a(n) = A_{n}(3) where A_{n}(x) are the Eulerian polynomials. - _Peter Luschny_, Aug 03 2010
E.g.f.: (exp(x) - 2*cosh(x))/(2*exp(x) - 3*cosh(x)) =1 + x/(U(0)-x) where U(k)=  4*k+1 - x/(1 + x/(4*k+3 - x/(1 + x/U(k+1)))); (continued fraction, 4-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Nov 08 2012
G.f.: 1 + x/G(0) where G(k) = 1 - x*2*(2*k+2) + x^2*(k+1)*(k+2)*(1-2^2)/G(k+1); (continued fraction due to T. J. Stieltjes). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Jan 11 2013
G.f.: 1/Q(0), where Q(k) = 1 - x*(4*k+1) - 3*x^2*(k+1)^2/Q(k+1); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Sep 30 2013
Special values of the generalized hypergeometric function n_F_(n-1):

a(n) = (2^(n+1)/9) * hypergeom([2,2,..2],[1,1,..1],1/3), where the sequence in the first square bracket ("upper" parameters) has n elements all equal to 2 whereas the sequence in the second square bracket ("lower" parameters) has n-1 elements all equal to 1.
a(n) = (-1)^(n+1)*(Li_{-n}(sqrt(3)) + Li_{-n}(-sqrt(3)))/3, where Li_n(x) is the polylogarithm. - _Vladimir Reshetnikov_, Oct 31 2015
a(0) = 1; a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} binomial(n,k) * 2^(k - 1) * a(n-k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jan 16 2020
maple: gf := -2/(exp(2*x) - 3): series(gf, x, 21): seq(n!*coeff(%, x, n), n=0..20);
mathematica: Eulerian1[0, 0] = 1; Eulerian1[n_, k_] := Sum[(-1)^j (k-j+1)^n Binomial[ n+1, j], {j, 0, k+1}]; Table[Sum[Eulerian1[n, k]*3^k, {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 20}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 13 2019, after _Peter Luschny_ *)
results.author: _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 22 2006
ext: a(7) corrected (was 206672), a(n) extended, formula added _Peter Luschny_, Aug 03 2010
